title: Interrupting incremental build via Ctrl-C can lead to linker error in next build
body:
Incremental builds seem to not be Ctrl-C-safe:
After doing some changes in rustc, I started a build and interrupted it mid-way through:
```
Building stage0 compiler artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
   Compiling rustc_const_eval v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_const_eval)
   Compiling rustc_codegen_ssa v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_codegen_ssa)
   Compiling rustc_borrowck v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_borrowck)
   Compiling rustc_mir_transform v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_mir_transform)
   Compiling rustc_codegen_llvm v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_codegen_llvm)
   Compiling rustc_interface v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_interface)
   Compiling rustc_driver_impl v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_driver_impl)
^C  Building [=======================> ] 297/301: rustc_mir_transform                                                                                                                                                                     
Build completed successfully in 0:00:29
```
Then I re-invoked `x.py` to finish the build, and got a linker error:
```
$ nice ./x.py run src/tools/miri --stage 0 --args src/tools/miri/tests/pass/dyn-star.rs --args --edition --args 2021 --keep-stage-std 1
Building bootstrap
    Finished dev [unoptimized] target(s) in 0.05s
Building stage0 library artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
    Finished release [optimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.47s
Copying stage0 library from stage0 (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu / x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
Building stage0 compiler artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
   Compiling rustc_mir_transform v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_mir_transform)
   Compiling rustc_interface v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_interface)
   Compiling rustc_driver_impl v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_driver_impl)
   Compiling rustc_driver v0.0.0 (/home/r/src/rust/rustc/compiler/rustc_driver)
error: linking with `cc` failed: exit status: 1
  |
  = note: LC_ALL="C" PATH="/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-sysroot/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/bin:/home/r/.opam/system/bin:/home/r/bin:/home/r/.cargo/bin:/home/r/.local/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/local/games:/usr/games" VSLANG="1033" "cc" "-Wl,--version-script=/tmp/rustc17oSRA/list" "-m64" "/tmp/rustc17oSRA/symbols.o" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/rustc_driver-1c51052c40443113.2aoe33u5hzbaomjw.rcgu.o" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/rustc_driver-1c51052c40443113.1ec6zjhhv8zle1vx.rcgu.rmeta" "-Wl,--as-needed" "-L" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps" "-L" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/release/deps" "-L" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/build/psm-d41c6ee481625ea1/out" "-L" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/build/rustc_llvm-48c53d61fdf5ac4f/out" "-L" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/ci-llvm/lib" "-L" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-sysroot/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib" "-Wl,-Bstatic" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/librustc_driver_impl-39f2fefd12be0c5a.rlib" "/home/r/src/rust/rustc/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0-rustc/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/release/deps/librustc_log-0bffd69170ed641f.rlib"
```
